result.execSummary:
The defendant Larence C McMorris Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court advised defendant of his rights as they relate to firearms and voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larence C McMorris Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR RESTITUTION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Larence C McMorris not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel waived the defendant's appearance.
State has no proof of restitution owed.
Court ordered restitution set at -0-.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Larence C McMorris not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel waived the defendant's appearance for today's date.
The district attorney informs the court that the victim has not received all of her medical bills and they are asking for another date for the restitution hearing.
  Restitution hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 1 as amended:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections CONSECUTIVE to the sentence on Count 2. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation. Probation is to run concurrent to the sentence in Count 2.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 39 days credit, with NO release privileges.


  Conditions of Probation:
- 60 days condition time. Court stayed this pending probation review(s).
- Complete a Batterers Intervention programming.
- Complete an AODA assessment. 
-Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- No contact with the victim as specified in the criminal complaint.
- Provide a DNA sample if one has not already been given.

Court ordered the probation agent to schedule a probation review 60 days after the defendant has been released from the House of Correction.

Resutitution to be determined at a hearing. Defendant waived his appearance for this proceeding. 

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs and surcharges (including DNA and domestic violence surcharges); 
All applicable fees of supervision.

Court advised the defendant of his rights as they relate to firearms and voting.

Filed:  
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Larence C McMorris in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Larence C McMorris in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered the repeater enhancer on Count 1 dismissed (pursuant to Wis Stats. 939.62(1)(a).

As to Count 1 as amended and Count 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Larence C McMorris not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing.  Case adjourned to branch 36.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with N.D. (5/24/72).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Larence C McMorris in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Larence C McMorris in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Larence C McMorris Jr

Prior: 2010 South 17th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
